msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for Northern District of Washington.
In the Matter of the Application of D.A. Hatfield, for a writ of Habeas Corpus.
Answer Order to show cause No. 2082

Comes now Robert T. Hodge, Sheriff of King County, by his attorneys John F. Murphy and Hugh M. Caldwell, and complying with the order of the above entitled court issued herein on the 5th day of Feburary, 1912, directing that cause be shown why a writ of Habeas Corpus should not issue herein as prayed for by the petitioner D.A. Hatfield, and alleges as follows:
1. The said petition does not state facts sufficient to warrant the issuance of said writ as prayed for.

2. The said petition upon its face contains facts which show that he is not entitled to the writ of Habeas Corpus prayed for or to any other relief in this court, to wit, it shows that the petitioner is in the lawful custody of this respondent under and by virtue of a valid judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction, and a court of last resort in the State of Washington.
Wherefore, respondent prays that said writ be denied, and this proceeding dismissed
div1.ab: by Hugh W. Caldwell his atty.
div1.p: State of Washington County of King } ss.

Hugh. M. Caldwell, being first duly sworn, on oath says, that he has read the foregoing return, knows the contents thereof, and believes the same to be meritorous and well founded in law;p that he makes this verification as attorney for respondent Robert T. Hodge, and as one of the attroneys for said respondent.
Subscribed and sworn to be fore me this 6 day of Feburary, 1912.
div1.ab: Louis T. Silvain Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
div1.p: In the Circuit District Court of the United States for Western District of Washington Division
In the matter of Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus of D. A. Hatfield.
Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Feb 6 1912 A. N.l Engle Clerk By & Deputy
div1.ab: John F. Murphy Kenneth Mackintosh and Hugh M. Caldwell attys for Respondent
